To Sang-woo, it was a frightening intruder. "It's crawling away! Get it!" "I said kill it! Why won't you?" Without saying a word, Grandma shows Sang-woo how to treat life. She mends her worn-out rubber shoes. Once again, she asks Sang-woo to thread the needle. "Ugh, this is so annoying..." But now he threads it with ease. Then, disaster: the batteries in his game device run out. "Why's it not working? That's weird..." "I need new batteries. I need them! Give me money!" But her pockets only hold dust. "I'll pay you back double when Mom comes." "What's that? I don't even know what that is." Sang-woo searches the house but finds no money anywhere. He begins to express his anxiety and frustration in a childish way "Stupid." "Rock paper scissors!" "Rock." While Grandma naps, Sang-woo steals her hairpin and dashes off excitedly. "Battery! Battery! Hey, batteries!" He plans to trade the hairpin for some batteries. But this is a remote mountain village. "Batteries?" Finding a shop that sells them isn't easy.
